title: Victor Valdes' role at Barcelona is 'under threat due to falling out with Patrick Kluivert'
text:
Victor Valdes' position at Barcelona hangs in the balance as the former goalkeeper's relationship with Patrick Kluivert becomes ever more strained.

According to Football Espana, Valdes, who is a youth team coach and Kluivert, appointed as the club's director of youth football in the summer, don't see eye-to-eye, and the level of their disagreement has reached boiling point.

The pair are believed to have fallen out to the extent that former Spain international Valdes will not be on the sidelines during his team's game against Gimnastic de Tarragona this weekend.

Victor Valdes' position at Barcelona is under threat after a row with Patrick Kluivert

Kluivert, the director of youth football, has not seen eye-to-eye with Valdes since his arrival

In a statement published on the Barcelona website, the club said: 'Victor Valdes, coach of Juvenil A, will not travel to the game, which will be played against Gimnastic de Tarragona at the Municipal Camp de la Pobla de Mafumet'.

Valdes is now considering his options and has reportedly told his players of the severity of the situation.

The 37-year-old enjoyed a stellar career at the Nou Camp having risen through the ranks at La Masia. Valdes won six La Liga titltes and three Champions Leagues during a 12-year spell with the Spanish giants before leaving in 2014.

Valdes also played for Manchester United, Standard Liege and Middlesbrough before returning to his former club in July this year.
